page.title: 01Flawborough and district
page.content: The overall area covered by this survey is very rural and consists of four villages and part of a fifth. Within these villages there are three churches which form a central pivot around which many of the villagers lives revolves.Although unemployment is high,in these villages there is little unemployment.The main use of the land in this survey is arable farming although part of the area is for gypsum production.The only industrial enterprise is a factory making plasterboard + other gypsum products.The area is mainly flat and only at Flawborough is there a hill giving a view of the land.The area consists of small woods,a river various small streams and a disused gypsum site which has a lake which attracts wildlife and a variety of flora.
